title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
While pasta cooks, heat a large pan over medium heat and cook pancetta until crispy.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated cheeses, and plenty of black pepper.
Reserve 1 cup of pasta water before draining spaghetti.
Working quickly, add hot drained spaghetti to the pancetta pan.
Remove from heat and pour egg mixture over pasta, tossing continuously.
Add pasta water gradually until sauce becomes creamy.
Serve immediately with extra cheese and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, lemon juice, and 1 tsp garam masala for 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a large pan and cook chicken until browned. Set aside.
In the same pan, sauté onions until golden brown.
Add garlic, ginger, and spices. Cook for 2 minutes until fragrant.
Add canned tomatoes and simmer for 15 minutes.
Blend the sauce until smooth using an immersion blender.
Return chicken to the pan and add cream.
Simmer for 10 minutes until chicken is cooked through.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

title: Vegetable Stir Fry
summary: Quick and healthy vegetable stir fry with colorful bell peppers and broccoli.
instructions: Heat oil in a wok or large pan over high heat.
Add garlic and stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add harder vegetables first (carrots, broccoli) and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add remaining vegetables and continue stir-frying for 3-4 minutes.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, cornstarch, and water.
Pour sauce over vegetables and toss to coat.
Cook for 1-2 minutes until sauce thickens.
Garnish with sesame seeds and green onions.
Serve immediately with rice or noodles.

title: Chocolate Lava Cake
summary: Decadent chocolate cake with a warm, gooey center that flows like lava.
instructions: Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F). Butter 4 ramekins and dust with cocoa powder.
Melt chocolate and butter in a double boiler, stirring until smooth.
In a separate bowl, whisk eggs, egg yolks, and sugar until pale and thick.
Fold melted chocolate mixture into egg mixture.
Sift in flour and salt, fold gently until just combined.
Divide batter among prepared ramekins.
Bake for 12-14 minutes until edges are set but center is soft.
Let rest for 1 minute, then invert onto serving plates.
Dust with powdered sugar and serve immediately with ice cream.

title: Greek Salad
summary: Fresh and healthy Mediterranean salad with feta cheese, olives, and vegetables.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large bowl, combine tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and bell pepper.
Add Kalamata olives and cubed feta cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over salad and toss gently to combine.
Garnish with fresh parsley.
Let sit for 5-10 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld.
Serve as a side dish or light main course with crusty bread.

title: Beef Bourguignon
summary: French beef stew braised in red wine with mushrooms, onions, and bacon.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 160°C (325°F).
Cook bacon in a large Dutch oven until crispy. Remove and set aside.
Season beef with salt and pepper, brown in bacon fat in batches.
Sauté carrots and chopped onion until softened.
Add garlic and tomato paste, cook for 1 minute.
Sprinkle flour over vegetables and cook for 2 minutes.
Return beef and bacon to pot, add wine and enough stock to cover meat.
Add bay leaves and thyme, bring to simmer.
Cover and transfer to oven, braise for 2.5 hours.
Sauté pearl onions and mushrooms separately, add to stew last 30 minutes.
Remove bay leaves, adjust seasoning, and garnish with parsley.
Serve with mashed potatoes or crusty bread.
